20101230191312.000|20101230191315.000|TR0|JEALOUS:  All right.  Thank you, T.J.  And 
20101230191315.000|20101230191317.000|TR0|just two words for you in Georgia: John 
20101230191317.000|20101230191320.000|TR0|McNeal (ph).  That's the next case.

20101230191814.000|20101230191817.000|TR0|of historians found what they called an

20101230191819.000|20101230191822.000|TR0|grade history book.

20101230191842.000|20101230191844.000|TR0|MARTIN SAVIDGE, CNN CORRESPONDENT 
20101230191844.000|20101230191847.000|TR0|(voice-over):  The United States entered 
20101230191847.000|20101230191850.000|TR0|World War I in 1916.  No.  It was 1917.
20101230191850.000|20101230191853.000|TR0|
20101230191853.000|20101230191856.000|TR0|There were 12 Confederate states.  
20101230191856.000|20101230191858.000|TR0|Actually, there were 11.
20101230191858.000|20101230191901.000|TR0|
20101230191901.000|20101230191904.000|TR0|In 1800, New Orleans was a U.S. port.  No. 
20101230191904.000|20101230191907.000|TR0| It was still under Spanish control.
20101230191907.000|20101230191910.000|TR0|
20101230191910.000|20101230191912.000|TR0|These and dozens of other errors can be 
20101230191912.000|20101230191915.000|TR0|found in the textbook handed out to 
20101230191915.000|20101230191918.000|TR0|thousands of Virginia fourth graders.  
20101230191918.000|20101230191921.000|TR0|Problems with the book "Our Virginia: Past 
20101230191921.000|20101230191924.000|TR0| &  Present" published by Five Ponds Press 
20101230191924.000|20101230191926.000|TR0|first surfaced last October, as reported 
20101230191926.000|20101230191929.000|TR0|by "The Washington Post," when the mother 
20101230191929.000|20101230191932.000|TR0|of a fourth grader, a college history 
20101230191932.000|20101230191935.000|TR0|professor, spotted several lines on page 
20101230191935.000|20101230191938.000|TR0|122.
20101230191938.000|20101230191940.000|TR0|
20101230191940.000|20101230191943.000|TR0|PROF. CAROL SHERIFF, PARENT OF A VIRGINIA 
20101230191943.000|20101230191946.000|TR0|FOURTH GRADER:  It was particularly 
20101230191946.000|20101230191949.000|TR0|jarring when I got to this one passage 
20101230191949.000|20101230191952.000|TR0|that was so at odds with what historians 
20101230191952.000|20101230191954.000|TR0|have been saying about who participated in 
20101230191954.000|20101230191957.000|TR0|the civil war.
20101230191957.000|20101230192000.000|TR0|
20101230192000.000|20101230192003.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  The book says thousands of 
20101230192003.000|20101230192006.000|TR0|blacks fought in the confederate ranks, 
20101230192006.000|20101230192008.000|TR0|something not supported by mainstream 
20101230192008.000|20101230192011.000|TR0|Civil War scholarship, but it's the next 
20101230192011.000|20101230192014.000|TR0|line that's just plain wrong. "Including 
20101230192014.000|20101230192017.000|TR0|two black battalions under the command of 
20101230192017.000|20101230192020.000|TR0|Stonewall Jackson."
20101230192020.000|20101230192022.000|TR0|
20101230192022.000|20101230192025.000|TR0|SHERIFF:  The textbook actually does note 
20101230192025.000|20101230192028.000|TR0|that it wasn't until 1865 that 
20101230192028.000|20101230192031.000|TR0|African-Americans could legally serve in 
20101230192031.000|20101230192034.000|TR0|the confederate army.  It also tells 
20101230192034.000|20101230192036.000|TR0|children that Stonewall Jackson died in 
20101230192036.000|20101230192039.000|TR0|1863.
20101230192039.000|20101230192042.000|TR0|
20101230192042.000|20101230192045.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  The error about black serving in 
20101230192045.000|20101230192047.000|TR0|the confederate army was outrageous to 
20101230192047.000|20101230192050.000|TR0|many in academia.
20101230192050.000|20101230192053.000|TR0|
20101230192053.000|20101230192056.000|TR0|JEREMY MAYER, GEORGE MASON UNIVERSITY:  It 
20101230192056.000|20101230192059.000|TR0|is the equivalent of Holocaust denial

20101230192101.000|20101230192104.000|TR0|worse, it's also the equivalent of saying 
20101230192104.000|20101230192107.000|TR0|that the Jews helped the Holocaust.
20101230192107.000|20101230192110.000|TR0|

20101230192121.000|20101230192124.000|TR0|books, as well.

20101230192135.000|20101230192138.000|TR0|internet- only research.

20101230192149.000|20101230192152.000|TR0|textbook.  They were the ones who found 
20101230192152.000|20101230192155.000|TR0|the dozens more mistakes or

20101230192206.000|20101230192209.000|TR0|
20101230192209.000|20101230192211.000|TR0|(on camera):  As to who selected those

20101230192214.000|20101230192217.000|TR0|done by the individual school districts in 
20101230192217.000|20101230192220.000|TR0|Virginia that are now using the books.  To 
20101230192220.000|20101230192223.000|TR0|fix that problem of the wrong information 
20101230192223.000|20101230192225.000|TR0|regarding blacks serving in the 
20101230192225.000|20101230192228.000|TR0|confederacy, the publisher came up with 
20101230192228.000|20101230192231.000|TR0|this idea: stickers.  That would be with 
20101230192231.000|20101230192234.000|TR0|the right information placed over the 
20101230192234.000|20101230192236.000|TR0|wrong information.
20101230192236.000|20101230192239.000|TR0|
20101230192239.000|20101230192242.000|TR0|The problem is now there are so many
